intro: Myrsine oblongibacca, commonly known as the broad-leaved myrsine, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are usually dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruits are fleshy berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Myrsine oblongibacca is often found in moist, shaded environments in the understory of tropical forests.
